title: HTTP/2 Denial of Service Vulnerability
vulnerability_information:
**Summary:** Malformed HTTP/2 frames cause NodeJS http2 module to perform an uninitialized read. This results in a segmentation fault of the node process, causing a denial of service for all users of the instance.

**Description:** I have already worked extensively with the nodejs core security team on this issue. The issue has already been acknowledged by James Snell so this report is to officially get the issue on the books. All necessary details for this bug report have already been provided via security mailing list for nodejs. This issue is known to be present in v9 and v10 of nodejs.

## Steps To Reproduce:

Again, all the necessary repro instructions, core file, and stack traces have been provided to nodejs core security team.

  1. Setup HTTP/2 server with node.
  2. Send malformed HTTP/2 frames - I've noticed the issue with a GOAWAY frame, there are potentially others which also cause this issue.
  3. Observe crash of nodejs instance. Segmentation fault results in core file generation.


## Impact: Segfaults lead to denial of service vulnerability. Attacker is able to send malformed frame to crash the instance.

## Supporting Material/References: Already provided to nodejs core security team. Reference email threads with James Snell for additional details.

  * List any additional material (e.g. screenshots, logs, references, commits, code examples, etc.).

## Impact

Denial of service on NodeJS instances which use HTTP/2.

activities.message: Already being discussed with the reporter... fix is being worked on! :-)
activities.markdown_message: Already being discussed with the reporter... fix is being worked on! :-)

activities.message: FWIW, I have observed the altsvc frame type (decimal 10, hex 0xa) as causing this crash. The GOAWAY frame observation came from a different fuzz run but it appears the most reliable way I have found to cause this crash is to send a malformed client request with the altsvc frame type set. You may already know this based on our nghttp2 email threads but I wanted to document that observation here.
activities.markdown_message: FWIW, I have observed the altsvc frame type (decimal 10, hex 0xa) as causing this crash. The GOAWAY frame observation came from a different fuzz run but it appears the most reliable way I have found to cause this crash is to send a malformed client request with the altsvc frame type set. You may already know this based on our nghttp2 email threads but I wanted to document that observation here.

activities.message: Fix is ready to go, just waiting on scheduling for the release
activities.markdown_message: Fix is ready to go, just waiting on scheduling for the release

activities.message:
James, hope you are doing well. I just found out from my company HR team that I will be unable to accept any cash bounty for this bug. While it's not my favorite decision, I understand and accept the reasoning.

This bug report is free and does not request any cash bounty.

Take care,
Jordan

activities.message:
This was released and fixed in Node.js 10.4.1. Thank you very much Jordan.

Unfortunately Jordan is not able to receive a bounty.
